morning.description: Arrive in Pasadena, check into your accommodation, and enjoy a delicious breakfast at a local cafe like The Great Maple or Lavender & Honey Espresso Bar.
Step back in time at this masterpiece of American Arts and Crafts architecture. Take a docent-led tour to appreciate its intricate design and historical significance. (Purchase tickets in advance).

afternoon.description: Head to Old Pasadena and grab lunch at one of its many diverse eateries. Consider options like Mercado Pasadena for Mexican cuisine or The Kitchen for modern American fare.
Immerse yourself in the charming historic district. Explore boutique shops, art galleries, and admire the beautiful 19th-century architecture. Don't miss One Colorado for unique finds.

evening.description: Enjoy a delightful dinner experience in Old Pasadena. Suggestions include Union for modern Italian, Edwin Mills by Equator for gastropub fare, or Maestro for refined Mexican.
Wind down with a post-dinner drink at a cozy bar in Old Pasadena, such as The Speakeasy at the Edison or King's Row Gastropub.

morning.description: Grab a quick and delicious breakfast to fuel your day. Try Urth Caffé for organic coffee and breakfast items or Little Flower Candy Co. for pastries.

morning.activity: Immerse in The Huntington Library, Art Museum, and Botanical Gardens
morning.description: Spend the better part of your day exploring this world-renowned institution. Wander through stunning themed gardens (Japanese, Chinese, Desert, Rose), admire exquisite art collections, and delve into rare books.

afternoon.activity: Lunch at The Huntington or nearby
afternoon.description: Enjoy lunch at one of the cafes within The Huntington (such as the Rose Garden Tea Room or Red Car coffee shop) or head to a nearby spot outside the grounds.
There's so much to see! Dedicate more time to specific gardens or art galleries that piqued your interest, ensuring a moderate pace to enjoy every detail.

evening.description: Experience the sophisticated dining scene along South Lake Avenue. Choices range from True Food Kitchen for healthy options to The Luggage Room Pizzeria for gourmet pizza.
Check the schedule for a live theater performance at the historic Pasadena Playhouse, a regional landmark (requires advance booking).

morning.description: Enjoy a final Pasadena breakfast. Consider a spot like Millie's Cafe for classic American diner fare, then check out from your hotel.
Discover a magnificent collection of European art from the Renaissance to the 20th century, as well as an extensive Asian art collection, all housed in a beautifully designed space.

afternoon.description: Take a self-guided walk around the stunning Pasadena City Hall, admiring its Spanish Colonial Revival architecture. Then, enjoy a casual lunch at a cafe near the civic center.
Enjoy a tranquil stroll through Arlington Garden, Pasadena's only botanical garden dedicated to water-wise gardening. It's a peaceful oasis perfect for reflection.
Begin your journey home or to your next destination, filled with memories of Pasadena's beauty and culture.

additionalActivities.description: Take a guided tour of the iconic Rose Bowl Stadium, home of the annual Rose Bowl Game. Learn about its rich history and explore areas usually off-limits to the public. (Check tour availability and schedule).

additionalActivities.activity: Rose Bowl Flea Market (2nd Sunday of the month)
additionalActivities.description: If your visit aligns, experience one of the largest and most famous flea markets in the world, held on the second Sunday of each month. A treasure trove of antiques, vintage finds, and unique goods.

A short drive from Pasadena, Descanso Gardens offers stunning camellia collections, a rose garden, and a unique Enchanted Forest of Light installation during the holiday season (check November schedule).

additionalActivities.activity: Hiking at Eaton Canyon Natural Area & Falls
additionalActivities.description: Enjoy a moderate hike through a scenic canyon leading to a beautiful 40-foot waterfall. A refreshing outdoor activity perfect for nature lovers. (Check trail conditions beforehand).

additionalActivities.activity: Explore California Institute of Technology (Caltech) Campus
additionalActivities.description: Wander the beautiful and historic campus of Caltech, known for its stunning architecture and significant scientific contributions. See notable buildings and serene courtyards.
Beyond Old Pasadena, explore the upscale shopping district of South Lake Avenue, featuring department stores, high-end boutiques, and diverse dining options.
Delve deeper into Pasadena's rich past with exhibits on local history, culture, and influential figures, housed in the historic Fenyes Mansion.

additionalActivities.activity: Wine Tasting at a Local Winery/Bar
additionalActivities.description: Enjoy a relaxed afternoon or evening sampling local or regional wines at one of Pasadena's charming wine bars like The Raymond 1886 or Vertical Wine Bistro.

additionalActivities.activity: Cooking Class at Sur La Table (Old Pasadena)
additionalActivities.description: Participate in a hands-on cooking class focusing on various cuisines or techniques. A fun and interactive way to experience local culinary delights. (Check schedule and book in advance).

additionalActivities.activity: Scenic Drive to Mount Wilson Observatory
additionalActivities.description: Take a breathtaking drive up to Mount Wilson Observatory for panoramic views of the Los Angeles basin and the Pacific Ocean. Explore the historic telescopes and visitor center.

additionalActivities.activity: Rent Bicycles and Explore Arroyo Seco
additionalActivities.description: Rent bicycles and explore the scenic trails of the Arroyo Seco, offering a pleasant ride through natural beauty and past historical landmarks like the Colorado Street Bridge.
If open for the season in November, enjoy some recreational ice skating at a local rink – a fun activity to get into the holiday spirit.
